WRITING.TITLE: Welcome to the glass table, let's feast on this magical meal together, and allow the sounds to consume us...

WRITING.TEXT: If you see the most popular mukbangs, they're often visually satisfying - as in a similar colour and arranged/organised in a perfect way. If the video creator is also deliberately and simultaneously trying to create ASMR content, then the ASMR aspect would come from the careful attention to detail in placing the items of food, and the clear crisp sounds that come from touching and eating. It is also a phenomenon that appears to be more popular in Asian countries such as South Korea, as opposed to Europe. The mukbangers who have impressive edible foods such as expensive footwear, handbags or other objects sometimes commission chefs to make these items for their videos. This exclusivity aspect can also be appealing to a lot of people since they would otherwise not see or be able to buy those food items anywhere else.

WRITING.TITLE: Her head unintentionally drops from falling asleep! But the scalp massage is totally [Intentional]

WRITING.TEXT: Hi, Sorry for the confusion. I deleted it because I got an email saying it wasn't approved due to my new account being less than 2 days old. So I tried to post again. What can we do to solve this?

WRITING.TITLE: Gosh... who knew cutting amazon delivery boxes could be so [Intentional]ly relaxing before they get recycled
The ear to ear sounds in the makeup removal are so [Intentional]ly intense - She literally falls asleep too (watch the whole video and playlist)
The ear to ear sounds in the makeup removal are so [Intentional]ly intense - She literally falls asleep too (watch the whole video and playlist)

WRITING.TEXT: Wow! Didn't expect so many upvotes! You're all so amazing and it's great to know that our hard work doing research and finding the perfect triggers is working!
Great find! This voice is extremely triggering, especially the moment he starts talking again after a long pause.

WRITING.TITLE: It helps a lot to learn Spanish when it's softly spoken ear to ear and [Intentional]ly slow... This whispered Spanish is from Spain (not Latin America)... Listen to the whole video as you sleep... You'll wake up talking a new language!
[Discussion] What is your average YouTube watch time?
WRITING.TEXT: For the ASMRtists on YouTube, if you look at your Studio Analytics, at which point do most of your viewers drop off? I.e. Do you lose more than half of your viewers in the first 20 seconds, after 1 minute, after 5 minutes etc.?

WRITING.TITLE: (This week's new ASMR from Blue Siesta) "Stubble, Buttermilk, and Bank" are some of the 20 trigger words [intentional]ly [whisper]ed for you to induce relaxation and head tingles. Watch the whole video until the end!
(Blue Siesta) Even if it's not your birthday, you'll still get [intentional]ly triggered by these gentle party sounds and whispering. Featuring ear to ear talking, balloons, matches, and fire...

WRITING.TEXT: We're loving all the love from reddit over the last few weeks! Now we're uploading twice a week, on Thursdays and Mondays

WRITING.TITLE: The ear to ear sounds from this Spanish number counting is so [intentional]ly intense. Triggered the back of my neck and scalp. (watch the whole video)

We have worked incredibly hard for this [whisper] video over many days so we would really appreciate some feedback. The video uses 2x cameras and 3x microphones and is [52:37] [long]. The premise is an ASMR-style review of a new piece of kit - the Blue Yeti microphone. [male] + some [french accent]

WRITING.TEXT: Full timestamps are in the description, but we would love for you to add this this if you came across some other triggers in the video. [00:01](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=1s) Trigger teaser preview [00:35](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=35s) \------- CHAPTER 1: THE WHY ------- [02:37](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=157s) Analysis of the packaging [04:52](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=292s) A bit of French and tips on sounding like a native [07:06](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=426s) Talking about the microphones features [08:08](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=488s) Light scratching of the box with metal pointer stick [09:15](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=555s) \------- CHAPTER 2: THE OPENING ------- [12:32](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=752s) Thumbnail posing [16:38](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=998s) Unboxing [24:35](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=1475s) Scratching and tapping the mic with metal pointer stick [29:54](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=1794s) \------- CHAPTER 3: NEW SOUNDS ------- [31:05](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=1865s) Understanding the mic settings (reading the manual) [36:24](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=2184s) The windscreen covers [42:17](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=2537s) Scratching the mic [45:52](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=2752s) Massaging the mic (feels like scalp massage) [46:54](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=2814s) Another thumbnail pose [49:37](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=2977s) \------- CHAPTER 4: SHOCKMOUNT ------- [51:46](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ew8vf266vMU amp;t=3106s) "...yeti, yeti, yeti, yeti, yeti, yeti, yeti, yeti..."

WRITING.TITLE: (Blue Siesta) [female] White noise is relaxing in itself, but it's even better when you get triggered from it too! Here the hairdryer [intentional]ly moves around to visually calm you down, with [no talking] ear-to-ear movements (watch the whole video and playlist)
